hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major regulatory announcement, CPI print, Fed speech), a sharp, high-volume price spike that fails to sustain momentum and is followed by 4 consecutive 15-minute candles with narrowing ranges (each high-low range < 70% of the spike candle's range) and declining volume (< 50% of spike volume) will lead to a mean-reverting move back through the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) of the spike candle within the next 2 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news often triggers emotional, liquidity-driven spikes that exhaust quickly. A subsequent pattern of narrowing ranges and drying volume suggests the initial reaction was overdone and momentum has collapsed, creating a high-probability setup for a reversion to the fair price established during the high-volume event (proxied by VWAP).
entry_conditions: 15-min BTC candle with volume > 150% of 20-period average and |price change| > 2.5% (news spike)

Subsequent 4 consecutive 15-min candles show: 1) Each range (high-low) < 70% of spike candle range, 2) Each volume < 50% of spike candle volume, 3) Price remains in outer 30% of spike candle range (i.e., has not mean-reverted yet)
Current price is >1.5% away from the VWAP of the initial spike candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price crosses the VWAP of the initial spike candle
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves > 2.5% in the direction of the initial spike (beyond the spike candle's extreme)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In a sample of 50+ qualifying events, the mean-reversion to spike VWAP occurs in < 55% of cases within the 2-hour window, or the average win from successful trades does not exceed 1.25x the average loss.
